results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
results.description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
description_for_label: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Anne Pratten, Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Pratten, Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS

results.title: Goblin market
results.creator_credit: Megan Harding, Belinda Hall, Rachel Perkins and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Morning and evening
maids heard the goblin cry,
come buy our orchid fruits
come buy, come buy”
Goblin market by Christina Rossetti
Adapted from the poem by Christina Rosette about an age-old myth as seen through contemporary Australian eyes.
Cast: Rachel Maza (Laura), Lisa Maza (Lizzie)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Megan Harding, Belinda Hall, Rachel Perkins and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: Your brother, my tidda
results.creator_credit: Kathy Sport, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Coming out” to family, living with HIV and religion - some of the life changing situations faced by two Aboriginal gay men, Sam Barsah and Aaron Clark.
Sam has “come out” twice; first to his family about his sexuality and then about his HIV status. Like other indigenous gay men, he wants respect and understanding and only now, almost ten years later, does he feel able to speak openly about his story. Aaron is young and relatively new to Sydney. Growing up as a Jehovah’s Witness, he is looking for an alternative gay Christian group.
Using a contemporary blend of semi-observational filming, photos and animation, this short documentary about race and sexuality describes two very different stories of being Aboriginal and gay.
N.B. “Tidda” is an Aboriginal word for “sister”.

results.title: You dust mite be next
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A docudrama about the evil little dust mite that plagues the world using up close and personal microscopic images, horror tales from victims and a biology lesson from experts Dr Ewan Tovey and Michael Morris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS

results.title: Weeping willow
results.creator_credit: Louise Woodruff Sanz, Nicholas Price, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
She once described his dancing as being like the wind through the willow trees. She was his mentor and his best friend. She was his mum. Weeping Willow is the story of a dancer coming to terms with the death of his closest friend and biggest fan. It documents their journey to the present and into the future.
Features Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Lydia Miller, Joel Donahue
Contains some b&w images

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Cath Moore, Joe Weatherstone and Steven McGregor
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Cath Moore, Joe Weatherstone and Steven McGregor
